001package squidpony.squidai;
002
003import squidpony.squidgrid.Direction;
004import squidpony.squidgrid.LOS;
005import squidpony.squidmath.LightRNG;
006import squidpony.squidmath.RNG;
007
008import java.awt.Point;
009import java.util.*;
010
011/**
012 * An alternative to AStarSearch when you want to fully explore a search space, or when you want a gradient floodfill.
013 * If you can't remember how to spell this, just remember: Does It Just Know Stuff? That's Really Awesome!
014 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 4/4/2015.
015 */
016public class DijkstraMap
017{
018    /**
019     * The type of heuristic to use.
020     */
021    public enum Measurement {
022
023        /**
024         * The distance it takes when only the four primary directions can be
025         * moved in. The default.
026         */
027        MANHATTAN,
028        /**
029         * The distance it takes when diagonal movement costs the same as
030         * cardinal movement.
031         */
032        CHEBYSHEV,
033        /**
034         * The distance it takes as the crow flies. This will NOT affect movement cost when calculating a path,
035         * only the preferred squares to travel to (resulting in drastically more reasonable-looking paths).
036         */
037        EUCLIDEAN
038    }
039
040    /**
041     * This affects how distance is measured on diagonal directions vs. orthogonal directions. MANHATTAN should form a
042     * diamond shape on a featureless map, while CHEBYSHEV and EUCLIDEAN will form a square. EUCLIDEAN does not affect
043     * the length of paths, though it will change the DijkstraMap's gradientMap to have many non-integer values, and
044     * that in turn will make paths this finds much more realistic and smooth (favoring orthogonal directions unless a
045     * diagonal one is a better option).
046     */
047    public Measurement measurement = Measurement.MANHATTAN;
048
049
050    /**
051     * Stores which parts of the map are accessible and which are not. Should not be changed unless the actual physical
052     * terrain has changed. You should call initialize() with a new map instead of changing this directly.
053     */
054    public double[][] physicalMap;
055    /**
056     * The frequently-changing values that are often the point of using this class; goals will have a value of 0, and
057     * any cells that can have a character reach a goal in n steps will have a value of n. Cells that cannot be
058     * entered because they are solid will have a very high value equal to the WALL constant in this class, and cells
059     * that cannot be entered because they cannot reach a goal will have a different very high value equal to the
060     * DARK constant in this class.
061     */
062    public double[][] gradientMap;
063    /**
064     * Height of the map. Exciting stuff. Don't change this, instead call initialize().
065     */
066    public int height;
067    /**
068     * Width of the map. Exciting stuff. Don't change this, instead call initialize().
069     */
070    public int width;
071    /**
072     * The latest path that was obtained by calling findPath(). It will not contain the value passed as a starting
073     * cell; only steps that require movement will be included, and so if the path has not been found or a valid
074     * path toward a goal is impossible, this ArrayList will be empty.
075     */
076    public ArrayList<Point> path = new ArrayList<Point>();
077    /**
078     * Goals are always marked with 0.
079     */
080    public static final double GOAL = 0.0;
081    /**
082     * Floor cells, which include any walkable cell, are marked with a high number equal to 999200.0 .
083     */
084    public static final double FLOOR = 999200.0;
085    /**
086     * Walls, which are solid no-entry cells, are marked with a high number equal to 999500.0 .
087     */
088    public static final double WALL = 999500.0;
089    /**
090     * This is used to mark cells that the scan couldn't reach, and these dark cells are marked with a high number
091     * equal to 999800.0 .
092     */
093    public static final double DARK = 999800.0;
094    /**
095     * Goals that pathfinding will seek out. The Double value should almost always be 0.0 , the same as the static GOAL
096     * constant in this class.
097     */
098    public HashMap<Point, Double> goals;
099    private HashMap<Point, Double> fresh, closed, open;
100    /**
101     * The RNG used to decide which one of multiple equally-short paths to take.
102     */
103    public RNG rng;
104    private static int frustration = 0;
105
106    private boolean initialized = false;
107    /**
108     * Construct a DijkstraMap without a level to actually scan. If you use this constructor, you must call an
109     * initialize() method before using this class.
110     */
111    public DijkstraMap() {
112        rng = new RNG(new LightRNG());
113        path = new ArrayList<Point>();
114
115        goals = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
116        fresh = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
117        closed = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
118        open = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
119    }
120
121    /**
122     * Construct a DijkstraMap without a level to actually scan. This constructor allows you to specify an RNG before
123     * it is ever used in this class. If you use this constructor, you must call an initialize() method before using
124     * any other methods in the class.
125     */
126    public DijkstraMap(RNG random) {
127        rng = random;
128        path = new ArrayList<Point>();
129
130        goals = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
131        fresh = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
132        closed = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
133        open = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
134    }
135
136    /**
137     * Used to construct a DijkstraMap from the output of another.
138     * @param level
139     */
140    public DijkstraMap(final double[][] level) {
141        rng = new RNG(new LightRNG());
142        path = new ArrayList<Point>();
143
144        goals = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
145        fresh = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
146        closed = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
147        open = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
148        initialize(level);
149    }
150    /**
151     * Used to construct a DijkstraMap from the output of another, specifying a distance calculation.
152     * @param level
153     * @param measurement
154     */
155    public DijkstraMap(final double[][] level, Measurement measurement) {
156        rng = new RNG(new LightRNG());
157        this.measurement = measurement;
158        path = new ArrayList<Point>();
159
160        goals = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
161        fresh = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
162        closed = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
163        open = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
164        initialize(level);
165    }
166
167    /**
168     * Constructor meant to take a char[][] returned by DungeonGen.generate(), or any other
169     * char[][] where '#' means a wall and anything else is a walkable tile. If you only have
170     * a map that uses box-drawing characters, use DungeonUtility.linesToHashes() to get a
171     * map that can be used here.
172     *
173     * @param level
174     */
175    public DijkstraMap(final char[][] level) {
176        rng = new RNG(new LightRNG());
177        path = new ArrayList<Point>();
178
179        goals = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
180        fresh = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
181        closed = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
182        open = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
183        initialize(level);
184    }
185    /**
186     * Constructor meant to take a char[][] returned by DungeonGen.generate(), or any other
187     * char[][] where one char means a wall and anything else is a walkable tile. If you only have
188     * a map that uses box-drawing characters, use DungeonUtility.linesToHashes() to get a
189     * map that can be used here. You can specify the character used for walls.
190     *
191     * @param level
192     */
193    public DijkstraMap(final char[][] level, char alternateWall) {
194        rng = new RNG(new LightRNG());
195        path = new ArrayList<Point>();
196
197        goals = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
198        fresh = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
199        closed = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
200        open = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
201        initialize(level, alternateWall);
202    }
203
204    /**
205     * Constructor meant to take a char[][] returned by DungeonGen.generate(), or any other
206     * char[][] where '#' means a wall and anything else is a walkable tile. If you only have
207     * a map that uses box-drawing characters, use DungeonUtility.linesToHashes() to get a
208     * map that can be used here. This constructor specifies a distance measurement.
209     *
210     * @param level
211     * @param measurement
212     */
213    public DijkstraMap(final char[][] level, Measurement measurement) {
214        rng = new RNG(new LightRNG());
215        path = new ArrayList<Point>();
216        this.measurement = measurement;
217
218        goals = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
219        fresh = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
220        closed = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
221        open = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
222        initialize(level);
223    }
224
225    /**
226     * Used to initialize or re-initialize a DijkstraMap that needs a new PhysicalMap because it either wasn't given
227     * one when it was constructed, or because the contents of the terrain have changed permanently (not if a
228     * creature moved; for that you pass the positions of creatures that block paths to scan() or findPath() ).
229     * @param level
230     * @return
231     */
232    public DijkstraMap initialize(final double[][] level) {
233        width = level.length;
234        height = level[0].length;
235        gradientMap = new double[width][height];
236        physicalMap = new double[width][height];
237        for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
238            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
239                gradientMap[x][y] = level[x][y];
240                physicalMap[x][y] = level[x][y];
241            }
242        }
243        initialized = true;
244        return this;
245    }
246
247    /**
248     * Used to initialize or re-initialize a DijkstraMap that needs a new PhysicalMap because it either wasn't given
249     * one when it was constructed, or because the contents of the terrain have changed permanently (not if a
250     * creature moved; for that you pass the positions of creatures that block paths to scan() or findPath() ).
251     * @param level
252     * @return
253     */
254    public DijkstraMap initialize(final char[][] level) {
255        width = level.length;
256        height = level[0].length;
257        gradientMap = new double[width][height];
258        physicalMap = new double[width][height];
259        for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
260            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
261                double t = (level[x][y] == '#') ? WALL : FLOOR;
262                gradientMap[x][y] = t;
263                physicalMap[x][y] = t;
264            }
265        }
266        initialized = true;
267        return this;
268    }
269
270    /**
271     * Used to initialize or re-initialize a DijkstraMap that needs a new PhysicalMap because it either wasn't given
272     * one when it was constructed, or because the contents of the terrain have changed permanently (not if a
273     * creature moved; for that you pass the positions of creatures that block paths to scan() or findPath() ). This
274     * initialize() method allows you to specify an alternate wall char other than the default character, '#' .
275     * @param level
276     * @param alternateWall
277     * @return
278     */
279    public DijkstraMap initialize(final char[][] level, char alternateWall) {
280        width = level.length;
281        height = level[0].length;
282        gradientMap = new double[width][height];
283        physicalMap = new double[width][height];
284        for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
285            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
286                double t = (level[x][y] == alternateWall) ? WALL : FLOOR;
287                gradientMap[x][y] = t;
288                physicalMap[x][y] = t;
289            }
290        }
291        initialized = true;
292        return this;
293    }
294
295    /**
296     * Resets the gradientMap to its original value from physicalMap.
297     */
298    public void resetMap() {
299            if(!initialized) return;
300        for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
301            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
302                gradientMap[x][y] = physicalMap[x][y];
303            }
304        }
305    }
306
307    /**
308     * Resets this DijkstraMap to a state with no goals, no discovered path, and no changes made to gradientMap
309     * relative to physicalMap.
310     */
311    public void reset() {
312        resetMap();
313        goals.clear();
314        path.clear();
315        closed.clear();
316        fresh.clear();
317        open.clear();
318        frustration = 0;
319    }
320
321    /**
322     * Marks a cell as a goal for pathfinding, unless the cell is a wall or unreachable area (then it does nothing).
323     * @param x
324     * @param y
325     */
326    public void setGoal(int x, int y) {
327        if(!initialized) return;
328        if (physicalMap[x][y] > FLOOR) {
329            return;
330        }
331
332        goals.put(new Point(x, y), GOAL);
333    }
334
335    /**
336     * Marks a cell as a goal for pathfinding, unless the cell is a wall or unreachable area (then it does nothing).
337     * @param pt
338     */
339    public void setGoal(Point pt) {
340        if(!initialized) return;
341        if (physicalMap[pt.x][pt.y] > FLOOR) {
342            return;
343        }
344
345        goals.put(pt, GOAL);
346    }
347
348    /**
349     * Marks a specific cell in gradientMap as completely impossible to enter.
350     * @param x
351     * @param y
352     */
353    public void setOccupied(int x, int y) {
354        if(!initialized) return;
355        gradientMap[x][y] = WALL;
356    }
357
358    /**
359     * Reverts a cell to the value stored in the original state of the level as known by physicalMap.
360     * @param x
361     * @param y
362     */
363    public void resetCell(int x, int y) {
364        if(!initialized) return;
365        gradientMap[x][y] = physicalMap[x][y];
366    }
367
368    /**
369     * Reverts a cell to the value stored in the original state of the level as known by physicalMap.
370     * @param pt
371     */
372    public void resetCell(Point pt) {
373        if(!initialized) return;
374        gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y] = physicalMap[pt.x][pt.y];
375    }
376
377    /**
378     * Used to remove all goals and undo any changes to gradientMap made by having a goal present.
379     */
380    public void clearGoals() {
381        if(!initialized)
382            return;
383        for (Map.Entry<Point, Double> entry : goals.entrySet()) {
384            resetCell(entry.getKey());
385        }
386        goals.clear();
387    }
388
389    protected void setFresh(int x, int y, double counter) {
390        if(!initialized) return;
391        gradientMap[x][y] = counter;
392        fresh.put(new Point(x, y), counter);
393    }
394
395    protected void setFresh(final Point pt, double counter) {
396        if(!initialized) return;
397        gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y] = counter;
398        fresh.put(new Point(pt.x, pt.y), counter);
399    }
400
401    /**
402     * Recalculate the Dijkstra map and return it. Cells that were marked as goals with setGoal will have
403     * a value of 0, the cells adjacent to goals will have a value of 1, and cells progressively further
404     * from goals will have a value equal to the distance from the nearest goal. The exceptions are walls,
405     * which will have a value defined by the WALL constant in this class, and areas that the scan was
406     * unable to reach, which will have a value defined by the DARK constant in this class (typically,
407     * these areas should not be used to place NPCs or items and should be filled with walls). This uses the
408     * current measurement.
409     *
410     * @param impassable A Set of Position keys representing the locations of enemies or other moving obstacles to a
411     *                   path that cannot be moved through; this can be null if there are no such obstacles.
412     * @return A 2D double[width][height] using the width and height of what this knows about the physical map.
413     */
414    public double[][] scan(Set<Point> impassable) {
415        if(!initialized) return null;
416        if(impassable == null)
417            impassable = new HashSet<Point>();
418        HashMap<Point, Double> blocking = new HashMap<Point, Double>(impassable.size());
419        for (Point pt : impassable) {
420            blocking.put(pt, WALL);
421        }
422        closed.putAll(blocking);
423
424        for (Map.Entry<Point, Double> entry : goals.entrySet()) {
425            if (closed.containsKey(entry.getKey()))
426                closed.remove(entry.getKey());
427            gradientMap[entry.getKey().x][entry.getKey().y] = GOAL;
428        }
429        double currentLowest = 999000;
430        HashMap<Point, Double> lowest = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
431
432        for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
433            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
434                if (gradientMap[x][y] > FLOOR && !goals.containsKey(new Point(x, y)))
435                    closed.put(new Point(x, y), physicalMap[x][y]);
436                else if(gradientMap[x][y] < currentLowest)
437                {
438                    currentLowest = gradientMap[x][y];
439                    lowest.clear();
440                    lowest.put(new Point(x, y), currentLowest);
441                }
442                else if(gradientMap[x][y] == currentLowest)
443                {
444                    lowest.put(new Point(x, y), currentLowest);
445                }
446            }
447        }
448        int numAssigned = lowest.size();
449        open.putAll(lowest);
450        Direction[] dirs = (measurement == Measurement.MANHATTAN) ? Direction.CARDINALS : Direction.OUTWARDS;
451        while (numAssigned > 0) {
452//            ++iter;
453            numAssigned = 0;
454
455            for (Map.Entry<Point, Double> cell : open.entrySet()) {
456                for (int d = 0; d < dirs.length; d++) {
457                    Point adj = new Point(cell.getKey());
458                    adj.translate(dirs[d].deltaX, dirs[d].deltaY);
459                    double h = heuristic(dirs[d]);
460                    if (!closed.containsKey(adj) && !open.containsKey(adj) && gradientMap[cell.getKey().x][cell.getKey().y] + h < gradientMap[adj.x][adj.y]) {
461                        setFresh(adj, cell.getValue() + h);
462                        ++numAssigned;
463                    }
464                }
465            }
466            closed.putAll(open);
467            open = new HashMap<Point, Double>(fresh);
468            fresh.clear();
469        }
470        closed.clear();
471        open.clear();
472
473        for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
474            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
475                if (gradientMap[x][y] == FLOOR) {
476                    gradientMap[x][y] = DARK;
477                }
478            }
479        }
480
481        return gradientMap;
482    }
483
484    /**
485     * Recalculate the Dijkstra map up to a limit and return it. Cells that were marked as goals with setGoal will have
486     * a value of 0, the cells adjacent to goals will have a value of 1, and cells progressively further
487     * from goals will have a value equal to the distance from the nearest goal. If a cell would take more steps to
488     * reach than the given limit, it will have a value of DARK if it was passable instead of the distance. The
489     * exceptions are walls, which will have a value defined by the WALL constant in this class, and areas that the scan
490     * was unable to reach, which will have a value defined by the DARK constant in this class. This uses the
491     * current measurement.
492     *
493     * @param limit The maximum number of steps to scan outward from a goal.
494     * @param impassable A Set of Position keys representing the locations of enemies or other moving obstacles to a
495     *                   path that cannot be moved through; this can be null if there are no such obstacles.
496     * @return A 2D double[width][height] using the width and height of what this knows about the physical map.
497     */
498    public double[][] partialScan(int limit, Set<Point> impassable) {
499        if(!initialized) return null;
500        if(impassable == null)
501            impassable = new HashSet<Point>();
502        HashMap<Point, Double> blocking = new HashMap<Point, Double>(impassable.size());
503        for (Point pt : impassable) {
504            blocking.put(pt, WALL);
505        }
506        closed.putAll(blocking);
507
508        for (Map.Entry<Point, Double> entry : goals.entrySet()) {
509            if (closed.containsKey(entry.getKey()))
510                closed.remove(entry.getKey());
511            gradientMap[entry.getKey().x][entry.getKey().y] = GOAL;
512        }
513        double currentLowest = 999000;
514        HashMap<Point, Double> lowest = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
515
516        for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
517            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
518                if (gradientMap[x][y] > FLOOR && !goals.containsKey(new Point(x, y)))
519                    closed.put(new Point(x, y), physicalMap[x][y]);
520                else if(gradientMap[x][y] < currentLowest)
521                {
522                    currentLowest = gradientMap[x][y];
523                    lowest.clear();
524                    lowest.put(new Point(x, y), currentLowest);
525                }
526                else if(gradientMap[x][y] == currentLowest)
527                {
528                    lowest.put(new Point(x, y), currentLowest);
529                }
530            }
531        }
532        int numAssigned = lowest.size();
533        open.putAll(lowest);
534        Direction[] dirs = (measurement == Measurement.MANHATTAN) ? Direction.CARDINALS : Direction.OUTWARDS;
535        int iter = 0;
536        while (numAssigned > 0 && iter < limit) {
537//            ++iter;
538            numAssigned = 0;
539
540            for (Map.Entry<Point, Double> cell : open.entrySet()) {
541                for (int d = 0; d < dirs.length; d++) {
542                    Point adj = new Point(cell.getKey());
543                    adj.translate(dirs[d].deltaX, dirs[d].deltaY);
544                    double h = heuristic(dirs[d]);
545                    if (!closed.containsKey(adj) && !open.containsKey(adj) && gradientMap[cell.getKey().x][cell.getKey().y] + h < gradientMap[adj.x][adj.y]) {
546                        setFresh(adj, cell.getValue() + h);
547                        ++numAssigned;
548                    }
549                }
550            }
551            closed.putAll(open);
552            open = new HashMap<Point, Double>(fresh);
553            fresh.clear();
554            ++iter;
555        }
556        closed.clear();
557        open.clear();
558
559        for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
560            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
561                if (gradientMap[x][y] == FLOOR) {
562                    gradientMap[x][y] = DARK;
563                }
564            }
565        }
566
567        return gradientMap;
568    }
569
570    /**
571     * Recalculate the Dijkstra map for a creature that is potentially larger than 1x1 cell and return it. The value of
572     * a cell in the returned Dijkstra map assumes that a creature is square, with a side length equal to the passed
573     * size, that its minimum-x, minimum-y cell is the starting cell, and that any cell with a distance number
574     * represents the distance for the creature's minimum-x, minimum-y cell to reach it. Cells that cannot be entered
575     * by the minimum-x, minimum-y cell because of sizing (such as a floor cell next to a maximum-x and/or maximum-y
576     * wall if size is &gt; 1) will be marked as DARK. Cells that were marked as goals with setGoal will have
577     * a value of 0, the cells adjacent to goals will have a value of 1, and cells progressively further
578     * from goals will have a value equal to the distance from the nearest goal. The exceptions are walls,
579     * which will have a value defined by the WALL constant in this class, and areas that the scan was
580     * unable to reach, which will have a value defined by the DARK constant in this class. (typically,
581     * these areas should not be used to place NPCs or items and should be filled with walls). This uses the
582     * current measurement.
583     *
584     * @param impassable A Set of Position keys representing the locations of enemies or other moving obstacles to a
585     *                   path that cannot be moved through; this can be null if there are no such obstacles.
586     * @param size The length of one side of a square creature using this to find a path, i.e. 2 for a 2x2 cell
587     *             creature. Non-square creatures are not supported because turning is really hard.
588     * @return A 2D double[width][height] using the width and height of what this knows about the physical map.
589     */
590    public double[][] scan(Set<Point> impassable, int size) {
591        if(!initialized) return null;
592        if(impassable == null)
593            impassable = new HashSet<Point>();
594        HashMap<Point, Double> blocking = new HashMap<Point, Double>(impassable.size());
595        for (Point pt : impassable) {
596            blocking.put(pt, WALL);
597            for(int x = 0; x < size; x++)
598            {
599                for(int y = 0; y < size; y++)
600                {
601                    if(x + y == 0)
602                        continue;
603                    if(gradientMap[pt.x - x][pt.y - y] <= FLOOR)
604                        blocking.put(new Point(pt.x - x, pt.y - y), DARK);
605                }
606            }
607        }
608        closed.putAll(blocking);
609
610        for (Map.Entry<Point, Double> entry : goals.entrySet()) {
611            if (closed.containsKey(entry.getKey()))
612                closed.remove(entry.getKey());
613            gradientMap[entry.getKey().x][entry.getKey().y] = GOAL;
614        }
615        double currentLowest = 999000;
616        HashMap<Point, Double> lowest = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
617        Point p = new Point(0, 0), temp = new Point(0, 0);
618        for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
619            I_AM_BECOME_DEATH_DESTROYER_OF_WORLDS:
620            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
621                p.x = x;
622                p.y = y;
623                if (gradientMap[x][y] > FLOOR && !goals.containsKey(p)) {
624                    closed.put(new Point(p.x, p.y), physicalMap[x][y]);
625                    if(gradientMap[x][y] == WALL) {
626                        for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
627                            if (x - i < 0)
628                                continue;
629                            temp.x = x - i;
630                            for (int j = 0; j < size; j++) {
631                                temp.y = y - j;
632                                if (y - j < 0 || closed.containsKey(temp))
633                                    continue;
634                                if (gradientMap[temp.x][temp.y] <= FLOOR && !goals.containsKey(temp))
635                                    closed.put(new Point(temp.x, temp.y), DARK);
636                            }
637                        }
638                    }
639                }
640
641                else if(gradientMap[x][y] < currentLowest && !closed.containsKey(p))
642                {
643                    for(int i = 0; i < size; i++)
644                    {
645                        if(x + i >= width)
646                            continue I_AM_BECOME_DEATH_DESTROYER_OF_WORLDS;
647                        temp.x = x + i;
648                        for(int j = 0; j < size; j++)
649                        {
650                            temp.y = y + j;
651                            if(y + j >= height || closed.containsKey(temp))
652                                continue I_AM_BECOME_DEATH_DESTROYER_OF_WORLDS;
653                        }
654                    }
655
656                    currentLowest = gradientMap[x][y];
657                    lowest.clear();
658                    lowest.put(new Point(x, y), currentLowest);
659
660                }
661                else if(gradientMap[x][y] == currentLowest && !closed.containsKey(p))
662                {
663                    if(!closed.containsKey(p)) {
664                        for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
665                            if (x + i >= width)
666                                continue I_AM_BECOME_DEATH_DESTROYER_OF_WORLDS;
667                            temp.x = x + i;
668                            for (int j = 0; j < size; j++) {
669                                temp.y = y + j;
670                                if (y + j >= height || closed.containsKey(temp))
671                                    continue I_AM_BECOME_DEATH_DESTROYER_OF_WORLDS;
672                            }
673                        }
674                        lowest.put(new Point(x, y), currentLowest);
675                    }
676                }
677            }
678        }
679        int numAssigned = lowest.size();
680        open.putAll(lowest);
681        Direction[] dirs = (measurement == Measurement.MANHATTAN) ? Direction.CARDINALS : Direction.OUTWARDS;
682        while (numAssigned > 0) {
683            numAssigned = 0;
684            for (Map.Entry<Point, Double> cell : open.entrySet()) {
685                for (int d = 0; d < dirs.length; d++) {
686                    Point adj = new Point(cell.getKey().x, cell.getKey().y);
687                    adj.translate(dirs[d].deltaX, dirs[d].deltaY);
688                    double h = heuristic(dirs[d]);
689                    if (!closed.containsKey(adj) && !open.containsKey(adj) && gradientMap[cell.getKey().x][cell.getKey().y] + h < gradientMap[adj.x][adj.y]) {
690                        setFresh(new Point(adj.x, adj.y), cell.getValue() + h);
691                        ++numAssigned;
692                    }
693                }
694            }
695            closed.putAll(open);
696            open = new HashMap<Point, Double>(fresh);
697            fresh.clear();
698        }
699        closed.clear();
700        open.clear();
701
702        for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
703            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
704                if (gradientMap[x][y] == FLOOR) {
705                    gradientMap[x][y] = DARK;
706                }
707            }
708        }
709
710        return gradientMap;
711    }
712
713    /**
714     * Scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan with the listed goals and start point, and returns a list
715     * of Point positions (using the current measurement) needed to get closer to the closest reachable
716     * goal. The maximum length of the returned list is given by length; if moving the full length of
717     * the list would place the mover in a position shared by one of the positions in onlyPassable
718     * (which is typically filled with friendly units that can be passed through in multi-tile-
719     * movement scenarios), it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into that cell.
720     * The keys in impassable should be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved
721     * through, and will be ignored if there is a goal overlapping one.
722     *
723     * @param length
724     * @param impassable
725     * @param onlyPassable
726     * @param start
727     * @param targets
728     * @return
729     */
730    public ArrayList<Point> findPath(int length, Set<Point> impassable,
731                                     Set<Point> onlyPassable, Point start, Point... targets) {
732        if(!initialized) return null;
733        path = new ArrayList<Point>();
734        if(impassable == null)
735            impassable = new HashSet<Point>();
736        if(onlyPassable == null)
737            onlyPassable = new HashSet<Point>();
738
739        resetMap();
740        for (Point goal : targets) {
741            setGoal(goal.x, goal.y);
742        }
743        scan(impassable);
744        Point currentPos = new Point(start);
745        while (true) {
746            if (frustration > 500) {
747                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
748                break;
749            }
750            double best = 999000;
751            Direction[] dirs = shuffle((measurement == Measurement.MANHATTAN)
752                    ? Direction.CARDINALS : Direction.OUTWARDS);
753            int choice = rng.nextInt(dirs.length);
754
755            for (int d = 0; d < dirs.length; d++) {
756                Point pt = new Point(currentPos.x + dirs[d].deltaX, currentPos.y + dirs[d].deltaY);
757                if (gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y] < best) {
758                    best = gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y];
759                    choice = d;
760                }
761            }
762            if (best >= gradientMap[start.x][start.y]) {
763                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
764                break;
765            }
766            currentPos.y += dirs[choice].deltaY;
767            currentPos.x += dirs[choice].deltaX;
768            path.add(new Point(currentPos.x, currentPos.y));
769            frustration++;
770            if (path.size() >= length) {
771                if (onlyPassable.contains(currentPos)) {
772
773                    closed.put(currentPos, WALL);
774                    Set<Point> impassable2 = impassable;
775                    impassable2.add(currentPos);
776                    return findPath(length, impassable2, onlyPassable, start, targets);
777                }
778                break;
779            }
780            if(gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y] == 0)
781                break;
782        }
783        frustration = 0;
784        goals.clear();
785        return path;
786    }
787    /**
788     * Scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan with the listed goals and start point, and returns a list
789     * of Point positions (using the current measurement) needed to get closer to a goal, until preferredRange is
790     * reached, or further from a goal if the preferredRange has not been met at the current distance.
791     * The maximum length of the returned list is given by moveLength; if moving the full length of
792     * the list would place the mover in a position shared by one of the positions in onlyPassable
793     * (which is typically filled with friendly units that can be passed through in multi-tile-
794     * movement scenarios), it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into that cell.
795     * The keys in impassable should be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved
796     * through, and will be ignored if there is a goal overlapping one.
797     *
798     * @param moveLength
799     * @param preferredRange
800     * @param los a squidgrid.LOS object if the preferredRange should try to stay in line of sight, or null if LoS
801     *            should be disregarded.
802     * @param impassable
803     * @param onlyPassable
804     * @param start
805     * @param targets
806     * @return
807     */
808    public ArrayList<Point> findAttackPath(int moveLength, int preferredRange, LOS los, Set<Point> impassable,
809                                           Set<Point> onlyPassable, Point start, Point... targets) {
810        if(!initialized) return null;
811        if(preferredRange < 0) preferredRange = 0;
812        double[][] resMap = new double[width][height];
813        if(los != null)
814        {
815            for(int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
816                for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
817                    resMap[x][y] = (physicalMap[x][y] == WALL) ? 1.0 : 0.0;
818                }
819            }
820        }
821        path = new ArrayList<Point>();
822        if(impassable == null)
823            impassable = new HashSet<Point>();
824        if(onlyPassable == null)
825            onlyPassable = new HashSet<Point>();
826
827        resetMap();
828        for (Point goal : targets) {
829            setGoal(goal.x, goal.y);
830        }
831        Measurement mess = measurement;
832        if(measurement == Measurement.EUCLIDEAN)
833        {
834            measurement = Measurement.CHEBYSHEV;
835        }
836        scan(impassable);
837        goals.clear();
838
839        for(int x = 0; x < width; x++)
840        {
841            CELL:
842            for(int y = 0; y < height; y++)
843            {
844                if(gradientMap[x][y] == WALL || gradientMap[x][y] == DARK)
845                    continue;
846                if (gradientMap[x][y] == preferredRange && los != null) {
847                    for (Point goal : targets) {
848                        if (los.isReachable(resMap, x, y, goal.x, goal.y)) {
849                            setGoal(x, y);
850                            gradientMap[x][y] = 0;
851                            continue CELL;
852                        }
853                    }
854                    gradientMap[x][y] = FLOOR;
855                }
856                else
857                    gradientMap[x][y] = FLOOR;
858            }
859        }
860        measurement = mess;
861        scan(impassable);
862
863        Point currentPos = new Point(start);
864        while (true) {
865            if (frustration > 500) {
866                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
867                break;
868            }
869            double best = 999000;
870            Direction[] dirs = shuffle((measurement == Measurement.MANHATTAN)
871                    ? Direction.CARDINALS : Direction.OUTWARDS);
872            int choice = rng.nextInt(dirs.length);
873
874            for (int d = 0; d < dirs.length; d++) {
875                Point pt = new Point(currentPos.x + dirs[d].deltaX, currentPos.y + dirs[d].deltaY);
876                if (gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y] < best) {
877                    best = gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y];
878                    choice = d;
879                }
880            }
881            if (best >= gradientMap[start.x][start.y]) {
882                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
883                break;
884            }
885            currentPos.y += dirs[choice].deltaY;
886            currentPos.x += dirs[choice].deltaX;
887            path.add(new Point(currentPos.x, currentPos.y));
888            frustration++;
889            if (path.size() >= moveLength) {
890                if (onlyPassable.contains(currentPos)) {
891
892                    closed.put(currentPos, WALL);
893                    Set<Point> impassable2 = impassable;
894                    impassable2.add(currentPos);
895                    return findAttackPath(moveLength, preferredRange, los, impassable2, onlyPassable, start, targets);
896                }
897                break;
898            }
899            if(gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y] == 0)
900                break;
901        }
902        frustration = 0;
903        goals.clear();
904        return path;
905    }
906    /**
907     * Scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan with the listed goals and start point, and returns a list
908     * of Point positions (using the current measurement) needed to get closer to a goal, until a cell is reached with
909     * a distance from a goal that is at least equal to minPreferredRange and no more than maxPreferredRange,
910     * which may go further from a goal if the minPreferredRange has not been met at the current distance.
911     * The maximum length of the returned list is given by moveLength; if moving the full length of
912     * the list would place the mover in a position shared by one of the positions in onlyPassable
913     * (which is typically filled with friendly units that can be passed through in multi-tile-
914     * movement scenarios), it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into that cell.
915     * The keys in impassable should be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved
916     * through, and will be ignored if there is a goal overlapping one.
917     *
918     * @param moveLength
919     * @param minPreferredRange
920     * @param maxPreferredRange
921     * @param los a squidgrid.LOS object if the preferredRange should try to stay in line of sight, or null if LoS
922     *            should be disregarded.
923     * @param impassable
924     * @param onlyPassable
925     * @param start
926     * @param targets
927     * @return
928     */
929    public ArrayList<Point> findAttackPath(int moveLength, int minPreferredRange, int maxPreferredRange, LOS los,
930                                           Set<Point> impassable, Set<Point> onlyPassable, Point start, Point... targets) {
931        if(!initialized) return null;
932        if(minPreferredRange < 0) minPreferredRange = 0;
933        if(maxPreferredRange < minPreferredRange) maxPreferredRange = minPreferredRange;
934        double[][] resMap = new double[width][height];
935        if(los != null)
936        {
937            for(int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
938                for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
939                    resMap[x][y] = (physicalMap[x][y] == WALL) ? 1.0 : 0.0;
940                }
941            }
942        }
943        path = new ArrayList<Point>();
944        if(impassable == null)
945            impassable = new HashSet<Point>();
946        if(onlyPassable == null)
947            onlyPassable = new HashSet<Point>();
948
949        resetMap();
950        for (Point goal : targets) {
951            setGoal(goal.x, goal.y);
952        }
953        Measurement mess = measurement;
954        if(measurement == Measurement.EUCLIDEAN)
955        {
956            measurement = Measurement.CHEBYSHEV;
957        }
958        scan(impassable);
959        goals.clear();
960
961        for(int x = 0; x < width; x++)
962        {
963            CELL:
964            for(int y = 0; y < height; y++)
965            {
966                if(gradientMap[x][y] == WALL || gradientMap[x][y] == DARK)
967                    continue;
968                if (gradientMap[x][y] >= minPreferredRange && gradientMap[x][y] <= maxPreferredRange
969                        && los != null) {
970                    for (Point goal : targets) {
971                        if (los.isReachable(resMap, x, y, goal.x, goal.y)) {
972                            setGoal(x, y);
973                            gradientMap[x][y] = 0;
974                            continue CELL;
975                        }
976                    }
977                    gradientMap[x][y] = FLOOR;
978                }
979                else
980                    gradientMap[x][y] = FLOOR;
981            }
982        }
983        measurement = mess;
984        scan(impassable);
985
986        Point currentPos = new Point(start);
987        while (true) {
988            if (frustration > 500) {
989                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
990                break;
991            }
992            double best = 999000;
993            Direction[] dirs = shuffle((measurement == Measurement.MANHATTAN)
994                    ? Direction.CARDINALS : Direction.OUTWARDS);
995            int choice = rng.nextInt(dirs.length);
996
997            for (int d = 0; d < dirs.length; d++) {
998                Point pt = new Point(currentPos.x + dirs[d].deltaX, currentPos.y + dirs[d].deltaY);
999                if (gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y] < best) {
1000                    best = gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y];
1001                    choice = d;
1002                }
1003            }
1004            if (best >= gradientMap[start.x][start.y]) {
1005                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1006                break;
1007            }
1008            currentPos.y += dirs[choice].deltaY;
1009            currentPos.x += dirs[choice].deltaX;
1010            path.add(new Point(currentPos.x, currentPos.y));
1011            frustration++;
1012            if (path.size() >= moveLength) {
1013                if (onlyPassable.contains(currentPos)) {
1014
1015                    closed.put(currentPos, WALL);
1016                    Set<Point> impassable2 = impassable;
1017                    impassable2.add(currentPos);
1018                    return findAttackPath(moveLength, minPreferredRange, maxPreferredRange, los, impassable2,
1019                            onlyPassable, start, targets);
1020                }
1021                break;
1022            }
1023            if(gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y] == 0)
1024                break;
1025        }
1026        frustration = 0;
1027        goals.clear();
1028        return path;
1029    }
1030
1031    private double cachedLongerPaths = 1.2;
1032    private Set<Point> cachedImpassable = new HashSet<Point>();
1033    private Point[] cachedFearSources;
1034    private double[][] cachedFleeMap;
1035    private int cachedSize = 1;
1036    /**
1037     * Scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan with the listed fearSources and start point, and returns a list
1038     * of Point positions (using Manhattan distance) needed to get further from the closest fearSources, meant
1039     * for running away. The maximum length of the returned list is given by length; if moving the full
1040     * length of the list would place the mover in a position shared by one of the positions in onlyPassable
1041     * (which is typically filled with friendly units that can be passed through in multi-tile-
1042     * movement scenarios), it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into that cell.
1043     * The keys in impassable should be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved
1044     * through, and will be ignored if there is a fearSource overlapping one. The preferLongerPaths parameter
1045     * is meant to be tweaked and adjusted; higher values should make creatures prefer to escape out of
1046     * doorways instead of hiding in the closest corner, and a value of 1.2 should be typical for many maps.
1047     * The parameters preferLongerPaths, impassable, and the varargs used for fearSources will be cached, and
1048     * any subsequent calls that use the same values as the last values passed will avoid recalculating
1049     * unnecessary scans.
1050     *
1051     * @param length
1052     * @param preferLongerPaths Set this to 1.2 if you aren't sure; it will probably need tweaking for different maps.
1053     * @param impassable
1054     * @param onlyPassable
1055     * @param start
1056     * @param fearSources
1057     * @return
1058     */
1059    public ArrayList<Point> findFleePath(int length, double preferLongerPaths, Set<Point> impassable,
1060                                         Set<Point> onlyPassable, Point start, Point... fearSources) {
1061        if (!initialized) return null;
1062        path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1063        if (impassable == null)
1064            impassable = new HashSet<Point>();
1065        if (onlyPassable == null)
1066            onlyPassable = new HashSet<Point>();
1067        if (fearSources == null || fearSources.length < 1) {
1068            path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1069            return path;
1070        }
1071        if (cachedSize == 1 && preferLongerPaths == cachedLongerPaths && impassable.equals(cachedImpassable) &&
1072                fearSources.equals(cachedFearSources)) {
1073            gradientMap = cachedFleeMap;
1074        }
1075        else {
1076            cachedLongerPaths = preferLongerPaths;
1077            cachedImpassable = new HashSet<Point>(impassable);
1078            cachedFearSources = fearSources.clone();
1079            cachedSize = 1;
1080            resetMap();
1081            for (Point goal : fearSources) {
1082                setGoal(goal.x, goal.y);
1083            }
1084            scan(impassable);
1085
1086            for (int x = 0; x < gradientMap.length; x++) {
1087                for (int y = 0; y < gradientMap[x].length; y++) {
1088                    gradientMap[x][y] *= (gradientMap[x][y] >= FLOOR) ? 1.0 : (0.0 - preferLongerPaths);
1089                }
1090            }
1091            scan(impassable);
1092            cachedFleeMap = gradientMap.clone();
1093        }
1094        Point currentPos = new Point(start);
1095        while (true) {
1096            if (frustration > 500) {
1097                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1098                break;
1099            }
1100            double best = 999000;
1101            Direction[] dirs = shuffle((measurement == Measurement.MANHATTAN)
1102                    ? Direction.CARDINALS : Direction.OUTWARDS);
1103            int choice = rng.nextInt(dirs.length);
1104
1105            for (int d = 0; d < dirs.length; d++) {
1106                Point pt = new Point(currentPos.x + dirs[d].deltaX, currentPos.y + dirs[d].deltaY);
1107                if (gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y] < best) {
1108                    best = gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y];
1109                    choice = d;
1110                }
1111            }
1112            if (best >= gradientMap[start.x][start.y]) {
1113                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1114                break;
1115            }
1116            currentPos.y += dirs[choice].deltaY;
1117            currentPos.x += dirs[choice].deltaX;
1118            if(path.size() > 0) {
1119                Point last = path.get(path.size() - 1);
1120                if (gradientMap[last.x][last.y] <= gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y])
1121                    break;
1122            }
1123            path.add(new Point(currentPos.x, currentPos.y));
1124            frustration++;
1125            if (path.size() >= length) {
1126                if (onlyPassable.contains(currentPos)) {
1127
1128                    closed.put(currentPos, WALL);
1129                    Set<Point> impassable2 = impassable;
1130                    impassable2.add(currentPos);
1131                    return findFleePath(length, preferLongerPaths, impassable2, onlyPassable, start, fearSources);
1132                }
1133                break;
1134            }
1135        }
1136        frustration = 0;
1137        goals.clear();
1138        return path;
1139    }
1140    /**
1141     * Scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan with the listed goals and start point, and returns a list
1142     * of Point positions (using the current measurement) needed to get closer to the closest reachable
1143     * goal. The maximum length of the returned list is given by length; if moving the full length of
1144     * the list would place the mover in a position shared by one of the positions in onlyPassable
1145     * (which is typically filled with friendly units that can be passed through in multi-tile-
1146     * movement scenarios), it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into that cell.
1147     * The keys in impassable should be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved
1148     * through, and will be ignored if there is a goal overlapping one.
1149     * The parameter size refers to the side length of a square unit, such as 2 for a 2x2 unit. The
1150     * parameter start must refer to the minimum-x, minimum-y cell of that unit if size is &gt; 1, and
1151     * all positions in the returned path will refer to movement of the minimum-x, minimum-y cell.
1152     *
1153     * @param size
1154     * @param length
1155     * @param impassable
1156     * @param onlyPassable
1157     * @param start
1158     * @param targets
1159     * @return
1160     */
1161    public ArrayList<Point> findPathLarge(int size, int length, Set<Point> impassable,
1162                                     Set<Point> onlyPassable, Point start, Point... targets) {
1163        if(!initialized) return null;
1164        path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1165        if(impassable == null)
1166            impassable = new HashSet<Point>();
1167        if(onlyPassable == null)
1168            onlyPassable = new HashSet<Point>();
1169
1170        resetMap();
1171        for (Point goal : targets) {
1172            setGoal(goal.x, goal.y);
1173        }
1174        scan(impassable, size);
1175        Point currentPos = new Point(start);
1176        while (true) {
1177            if (frustration > 500) {
1178                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1179                break;
1180            }
1181            double best = 999000;
1182            Direction[] dirs = shuffle((measurement == Measurement.MANHATTAN)
1183                    ? Direction.CARDINALS : Direction.OUTWARDS);
1184            int choice = rng.nextInt(dirs.length);
1185
1186            for (int d = 0; d < dirs.length; d++) {
1187                Point pt = new Point(currentPos.x + dirs[d].deltaX, currentPos.y + dirs[d].deltaY);
1188                if (gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y] < best) {
1189                    best = gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y];
1190                    choice = d;
1191                }
1192            }
1193            if (best >= gradientMap[start.x][start.y]) {
1194                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1195                break;
1196            }
1197            currentPos.y += dirs[choice].deltaY;
1198            currentPos.x += dirs[choice].deltaX;
1199            path.add(new Point(currentPos.x, currentPos.y));
1200            frustration++;
1201            if (path.size() >= length) {
1202                if (onlyPassable.contains(currentPos)) {
1203
1204                    closed.put(currentPos, WALL);
1205                    Set<Point> impassable2 = impassable;
1206                    impassable2.add(currentPos);
1207                    return findPathLarge(size, length, impassable2, onlyPassable, start, targets);
1208                }
1209                break;
1210            }
1211            if(gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y] == 0)
1212                break;
1213        }
1214        frustration = 0;
1215        goals.clear();
1216        return path;
1217    }
1218    /**
1219     * Scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan with the listed goals and start point, and returns a list
1220     * of Point positions (using the current measurement) needed to get closer to a goal, until preferredRange is
1221     * reached, or further from a goal if the preferredRange has not been met at the current distance.
1222     * The maximum length of the returned list is given by moveLength; if moving the full length of
1223     * the list would place the mover in a position shared by one of the positions in onlyPassable
1224     * (which is typically filled with friendly units that can be passed through in multi-tile-
1225     * movement scenarios), it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into that cell.
1226     * The keys in impassable should be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved
1227     * through, and will be ignored if there is a goal overlapping one.
1228     * The parameter size refers to the side length of a square unit, such as 2 for a 2x2 unit. The
1229     * parameter start must refer to the minimum-x, minimum-y cell of that unit if size is &gt; 1, and
1230     * all positions in the returned path will refer to movement of the minimum-x, minimum-y cell.
1231     *
1232     * @param moveLength
1233     * @param preferredRange
1234     * @param los a squidgrid.LOS object if the preferredRange should try to stay in line of sight, or null if LoS
1235     *            should be disregarded.
1236     * @param impassable
1237     * @param onlyPassable
1238     * @param start
1239     * @param targets
1240     * @return
1241     */
1242    public ArrayList<Point> findAttackPathLarge(int size, int moveLength, int preferredRange, LOS los, Set<Point> impassable,
1243                                           Set<Point> onlyPassable, Point start, Point... targets) {
1244        if(!initialized) return null;
1245        if(preferredRange < 0) preferredRange = 0;
1246        double[][] resMap = new double[width][height];
1247        if(los != null)
1248        {
1249            for(int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
1250                for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
1251                    resMap[x][y] = (physicalMap[x][y] == WALL) ? 1.0 : 0.0;
1252                }
1253            }
1254        }
1255        path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1256        if(impassable == null)
1257            impassable = new HashSet<Point>();
1258        if(onlyPassable == null)
1259            onlyPassable = new HashSet<Point>();
1260
1261        resetMap();
1262        for (Point goal : targets) {
1263            setGoal(goal.x, goal.y);
1264        }
1265        Measurement mess = measurement;
1266        if(measurement == Measurement.EUCLIDEAN)
1267        {
1268            measurement = Measurement.CHEBYSHEV;
1269        }
1270        scan(impassable, size);
1271        goals.clear();
1272
1273        for(int x = 0; x < width; x++)
1274        {
1275            CELL:
1276            for(int y = 0; y < height; y++)
1277            {
1278                if(gradientMap[x][y] == WALL || gradientMap[x][y] == DARK)
1279                    continue;
1280                if (x+2 < width && y + 2 < height && gradientMap[x][y] == preferredRange && los != null) {
1281                    for (Point goal : targets) {
1282                        if (los.isReachable(resMap, x, y, goal.x, goal.y)
1283                                || los.isReachable(resMap, x+1, y, goal.x, goal.y)
1284                                || los.isReachable(resMap, x, y+1, goal.x, goal.y)
1285                                || los.isReachable(resMap, x+1, y+1, goal.x, goal.y)) {
1286                            setGoal(x, y);
1287                            gradientMap[x][y] = 0;
1288                            continue CELL;
1289                        }
1290                    }
1291                    gradientMap[x][y] = FLOOR;
1292                }
1293                else
1294                    gradientMap[x][y] = FLOOR;
1295            }
1296        }
1297        measurement = mess;
1298        scan(impassable, size);
1299
1300        Point currentPos = new Point(start);
1301        while (true) {
1302            if (frustration > 500) {
1303                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1304                break;
1305            }
1306            double best = 999000;
1307            Direction[] dirs = shuffle((measurement == Measurement.MANHATTAN)
1308                    ? Direction.CARDINALS : Direction.OUTWARDS);
1309            int choice = rng.nextInt(dirs.length);
1310
1311            for (int d = 0; d < dirs.length; d++) {
1312                Point pt = new Point(currentPos.x + dirs[d].deltaX, currentPos.y + dirs[d].deltaY);
1313                if (gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y] < best) {
1314                    best = gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y];
1315                    choice = d;
1316                }
1317            }
1318            if (best >= gradientMap[start.x][start.y]) {
1319                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1320                break;
1321            }
1322            currentPos.y += dirs[choice].deltaY;
1323            currentPos.x += dirs[choice].deltaX;
1324            path.add(new Point(currentPos.x, currentPos.y));
1325            frustration++;
1326            if (path.size() >= moveLength) {
1327                if (onlyPassable.contains(currentPos)) {
1328
1329                    closed.put(currentPos, WALL);
1330                    Set<Point> impassable2 = impassable;
1331                    impassable2.add(currentPos);
1332                    return findAttackPathLarge(size, moveLength, preferredRange, los, impassable2, onlyPassable, start, targets);
1333                }
1334                break;
1335            }
1336            if(gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y] == 0)
1337                break;
1338        }
1339        frustration = 0;
1340        goals.clear();
1341        return path;
1342    }
1343    /**
1344     * Scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan with the listed goals and start point, and returns a list
1345     * of Point positions (using the current measurement) needed to get closer to a goal, until a cell is reached with
1346     * a distance from a goal that is at least equal to minPreferredRange and no more than maxPreferredRange,
1347     * which may go further from a goal if the minPreferredRange has not been met at the current distance.
1348     * The maximum length of the returned list is given by moveLength; if moving the full length of
1349     * the list would place the mover in a position shared by one of the positions in onlyPassable
1350     * (which is typically filled with friendly units that can be passed through in multi-tile-
1351     * movement scenarios), it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into that cell.
1352     * The keys in impassable should be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved
1353     * through, and will be ignored if there is a goal overlapping one.
1354     * The parameter size refers to the side length of a square unit, such as 2 for a 2x2 unit. The
1355     * parameter start must refer to the minimum-x, minimum-y cell of that unit if size is &gt; 1, and
1356     * all positions in the returned path will refer to movement of the minimum-x, minimum-y cell.
1357     *
1358     * @param size
1359     * @param moveLength
1360     * @param minPreferredRange
1361     * @param maxPreferredRange
1362     * @param los a squidgrid.LOS object if the preferredRange should try to stay in line of sight, or null if LoS
1363     *            should be disregarded.
1364     * @param impassable
1365     * @param onlyPassable
1366     * @param start
1367     * @param targets
1368     * @return
1369     */
1370    public ArrayList<Point> findAttackPathLarge(int size, int moveLength, int minPreferredRange, int maxPreferredRange, LOS los,
1371                                           Set<Point> impassable, Set<Point> onlyPassable, Point start, Point... targets) {
1372        if(!initialized) return null;
1373        if(minPreferredRange < 0) minPreferredRange = 0;
1374        if(maxPreferredRange < minPreferredRange) maxPreferredRange = minPreferredRange;
1375        double[][] resMap = new double[width][height];
1376        if(los != null)
1377        {
1378            for(int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
1379                for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
1380                    resMap[x][y] = (physicalMap[x][y] == WALL) ? 1.0 : 0.0;
1381                }
1382            }
1383        }
1384        path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1385        if(impassable == null)
1386            impassable = new HashSet<Point>();
1387        if(onlyPassable == null)
1388            onlyPassable = new HashSet<Point>();
1389
1390        resetMap();
1391        for (Point goal : targets) {
1392            setGoal(goal.x, goal.y);
1393        }
1394        Measurement mess = measurement;
1395        if(measurement == Measurement.EUCLIDEAN)
1396        {
1397            measurement = Measurement.CHEBYSHEV;
1398        }
1399        scan(impassable, size);
1400        goals.clear();
1401
1402        for(int x = 0; x < width; x++)
1403        {
1404            CELL:
1405            for(int y = 0; y < height; y++)
1406            {
1407                if(gradientMap[x][y] == WALL || gradientMap[x][y] == DARK)
1408                    continue;
1409                if (x+2 < width && y + 2 < height && gradientMap[x][y] >= minPreferredRange && gradientMap[x][y] <= maxPreferredRange
1410                        && los != null) {
1411                    for (Point goal : targets) {
1412                        if (los.isReachable(resMap, x, y, goal.x, goal.y)
1413                                || los.isReachable(resMap, x+1, y, goal.x, goal.y)
1414                                || los.isReachable(resMap, x, y+1, goal.x, goal.y)
1415                                || los.isReachable(resMap, x+1, y+1, goal.x, goal.y)) {
1416                            setGoal(x, y);
1417                            gradientMap[x][y] = 0;
1418                            continue CELL;
1419                        }
1420                    }
1421                    gradientMap[x][y] = FLOOR;
1422                }
1423                else
1424                    gradientMap[x][y] = FLOOR;
1425            }
1426        }
1427        measurement = mess;
1428        scan(impassable, size);
1429
1430        Point currentPos = new Point(start);
1431        while (true) {
1432            if (frustration > 500) {
1433                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1434                break;
1435            }
1436            double best = 999000;
1437            Direction[] dirs = shuffle((measurement == Measurement.MANHATTAN)
1438                    ? Direction.CARDINALS : Direction.OUTWARDS);
1439            int choice = rng.nextInt(dirs.length);
1440
1441            for (int d = 0; d < dirs.length; d++) {
1442                Point pt = new Point(currentPos.x + dirs[d].deltaX, currentPos.y + dirs[d].deltaY);
1443                if (gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y] < best) {
1444                    best = gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y];
1445                    choice = d;
1446                }
1447            }
1448            if (best >= gradientMap[start.x][start.y]) {
1449                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1450                break;
1451            }
1452            currentPos.y += dirs[choice].deltaY;
1453            currentPos.x += dirs[choice].deltaX;
1454            path.add(new Point(currentPos.x, currentPos.y));
1455            frustration++;
1456            if (path.size() >= moveLength) {
1457                if (onlyPassable.contains(currentPos)) {
1458
1459                    closed.put(currentPos, WALL);
1460                    Set<Point> impassable2 = impassable;
1461                    impassable2.add(currentPos);
1462                    return findAttackPathLarge(size, moveLength, minPreferredRange, maxPreferredRange, los, impassable2,
1463                            onlyPassable, start, targets);
1464                }
1465                break;
1466            }
1467            if(gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y] == 0)
1468                break;
1469        }
1470        frustration = 0;
1471        goals.clear();
1472        return path;
1473    }
1474
1475    /**
1476     * Scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan with the listed fearSources and start point, and returns a list
1477     * of Point positions (using Manhattan distance) needed to get further from the closest fearSources, meant
1478     * for running away. The maximum length of the returned list is given by length; if moving the full
1479     * length of the list would place the mover in a position shared by one of the positions in onlyPassable
1480     * (which is typically filled with friendly units that can be passed through in multi-tile-
1481     * movement scenarios), it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into that cell.
1482     * The keys in impassable should be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved
1483     * through, and will be ignored if there is a fearSource overlapping one. The preferLongerPaths parameter
1484     * is meant to be tweaked and adjusted; higher values should make creatures prefer to escape out of
1485     * doorways instead of hiding in the closest corner, and a value of 1.2 should be typical for many maps.
1486     * The parameters size, preferLongerPaths, impassable, and the varargs used for fearSources will be cached, and
1487     * any subsequent calls that use the same values as the last values passed will avoid recalculating
1488     * unnecessary scans. Calls to findFleePath will cache as if size is 1, and may share a cache with this function.
1489     * The parameter size refers to the side length of a square unit, such as 2 for a 2x2 unit. The
1490     * parameter start must refer to the minimum-x, minimum-y cell of that unit if size is &gt; 1, and
1491     * all positions in the returned path will refer to movement of the minimum-x, minimum-y cell.
1492     *
1493     * @param size
1494     * @param length
1495     * @param preferLongerPaths Set this to 1.2 if you aren't sure; it will probably need tweaking for different maps.
1496     * @param impassable
1497     * @param onlyPassable
1498     * @param start
1499     * @param fearSources
1500     * @return
1501     */
1502    public ArrayList<Point> findFleePathLarge(int size, int length, double preferLongerPaths, Set<Point> impassable,
1503                                         Set<Point> onlyPassable, Point start, Point... fearSources) {
1504        if (!initialized) return null;
1505        path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1506        if (impassable == null)
1507            impassable = new HashSet<Point>();
1508        if (onlyPassable == null)
1509            onlyPassable = new HashSet<Point>();
1510        if (fearSources == null || fearSources.length < 1) {
1511            path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1512            return path;
1513        }
1514        if (size == cachedSize && preferLongerPaths == cachedLongerPaths && impassable.equals(cachedImpassable)
1515                && fearSources.equals(cachedFearSources)) {
1516            gradientMap = cachedFleeMap;
1517        }
1518        else {
1519            cachedLongerPaths = preferLongerPaths;
1520            cachedImpassable = new HashSet<Point>(impassable);
1521            cachedFearSources = fearSources.clone();
1522            cachedSize = size;
1523            resetMap();
1524            for (Point goal : fearSources) {
1525                setGoal(goal.x, goal.y);
1526            }
1527            scan(impassable, size);
1528
1529            for (int x = 0; x < gradientMap.length; x++) {
1530                for (int y = 0; y < gradientMap[x].length; y++) {
1531                    gradientMap[x][y] *= (gradientMap[x][y] >= FLOOR) ? 1.0 : (0.0 - preferLongerPaths);
1532                }
1533            }
1534            scan(impassable, size);
1535            cachedFleeMap = gradientMap.clone();
1536        }
1537        Point currentPos = new Point(start);
1538        while (true) {
1539            if (frustration > 500) {
1540                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1541                break;
1542            }
1543            double best = 999000;
1544            Direction[] dirs = shuffle((measurement == Measurement.MANHATTAN)
1545                    ? Direction.CARDINALS : Direction.OUTWARDS);
1546            int choice = rng.nextInt(dirs.length);
1547
1548            for (int d = 0; d < dirs.length; d++) {
1549                Point pt = new Point(currentPos.x + dirs[d].deltaX, currentPos.y + dirs[d].deltaY);
1550                if (gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y] < best) {
1551                    best = gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y];
1552                    choice = d;
1553                }
1554            }
1555            if (best >= gradientMap[start.x][start.y]) {
1556                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1557                break;
1558            }
1559            currentPos.y += dirs[choice].deltaY;
1560            currentPos.x += dirs[choice].deltaX;
1561            if(path.size() > 0) {
1562                Point last = path.get(path.size() - 1);
1563                if (gradientMap[last.x][last.y] <= gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y])
1564                    break;
1565            }
1566            path.add(new Point(currentPos.x, currentPos.y));
1567            frustration++;
1568            if (path.size() >= length) {
1569                if (onlyPassable.contains(currentPos)) {
1570
1571                    closed.put(currentPos, WALL);
1572                    Set<Point> impassable2 = impassable;
1573                    impassable2.add(currentPos);
1574                    return findFleePathLarge(size, length, preferLongerPaths, impassable2, onlyPassable, start, fearSources);
1575                }
1576                break;
1577            }
1578        }
1579        frustration = 0;
1580        goals.clear();
1581        return path;
1582    }
1583
1584    /**
1585     * A simple limited flood-fill that returns a HashMap of Point keys to the Double values in the DijkstraMap, only
1586     * calculating out to a number of steps determined by limit. This can be useful if you need many flood-fills and
1587     * don't need a large area for each, or if you want to have an effect spread to a certain number of cells away.
1588     * @param radius the number of steps to take outward from each starting position.
1589     * @param starts a vararg group of Points to step outward from; this often will only need to be one Point.
1590     * @return A HashMap of Point keys to Double values; the starts are included in this with the value 0.0.
1591     */
1592    public HashMap<Point, Double> floodFill(int radius, Point... starts) {
1593        if(!initialized) return null;
1594        HashMap<Point, Double> fill = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
1595
1596        resetMap();
1597        for (Point goal : starts) {
1598            setGoal(goal.x, goal.y);
1599        }
1600        partialScan(radius, null);
1601        double temp;
1602        for(int x = 1; x < width - 1; x++)
1603        {
1604            for(int y = 1; y < height - 1; y++)
1605            {
1606                temp = gradientMap[x][y];
1607                if(temp < FLOOR)
1608                {
1609                    fill.put(new Point(x, y), temp);
1610                }
1611            }
1612        }
1613        goals.clear();
1614        return fill;
1615    }
1616
1617    /**
1618     * Shuffle a Direction array, useful for making a path more random.
1619     * @param dirs an array of Directions; will not be modified
1620     * @return a shuffled copy of dirs
1621     */
1622    public Direction[] shuffle(Direction[] dirs)
1623    {
1624        Direction[] array = dirs.clone();
1625        int n = array.length;
1626        for (int i = 0; i < n; i++)
1627        {
1628            int r = i + (int)(rng.nextDouble() * (n - i));
1629            Direction d = array[r];
1630            array[r] = array[i];
1631            array[i] = d;
1632        }
1633        return array;
1634    }
1635    private static final double root2 = Math.sqrt(2.0);
1636    private double heuristic(Direction target) {
1637        switch (measurement) {
1638            case MANHATTAN:
1639            case CHEBYSHEV:
1640                return 1.0;
1641            case EUCLIDEAN:
1642                switch (target) {
1643                    case DOWN_LEFT:
1644                    case DOWN_RIGHT:
1645                    case UP_LEFT:
1646                    case UP_RIGHT:
1647                        return root2;
1648                    default:
1649                        return  1.0;
1650                }
1651        }
1652        return 1.0;
1653    }
1654}
